desc: A stored procedure and user-defined function (UDF) is a set of SQL and procedural statements (declarations, assignments, loops, flow-of-control etc.) that stored on the database server and can be invoked using the SQL interface.   Quick Example:      -- Function increments the input value by 1    CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION increment(i INT) RETURNS INT AS $$     BEGIN       RETURN i + 1;     END;     $$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;          -- An example how to use the function (Returns: 11)     SELECT incr
